channel.title: Stupid Mistake
channel.description:
Okay, so I was trying to do SWAT's new emote system (http://www.rune-server.org/showthread.php?t=182332) and I was doing well until I hit this line:
And Add at the top of [code] public static void method257(int i, Class44 class44)[/code] this [code] for(int j = 0; j < FrameStart.length; j++) FrameStart[j] = 0;[/code]
So I've been messing around (sorry, java newb here :'( ) and I'm trying to figure this out.
So I did two things:
[code]public static void method257(int i, Class44 class44) { for(int j = 0; j < FrameStart.length; j++) FrameStart[j] = 0; Class30_Sub2_Sub2 class30_sub2_sub2 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub2(class44.method571("seq.dat", null), 891); anInt350 = class30_sub2_sub2.method410(); if(aClass20Array351 == null) aClass20Array351 = new Class20[anInt350]; for(int j = 0; j < anInt350; j++) { if(aClass20Array351[j] == null) aClass20Array351[j] = new Class20(); aClass20Array351[j].method259(true, class30_sub2_sub2);[/code]
And it gave me the following errors:
[code]Class36.java:18: cannot find symbol symbol : variable i location: class Class36 aClass36Array635 = new Class36[i + 1]; ^ Class36.java:18: incompatible types found : <nulltype> required: int aClass36Array635 = new Class36[i + 1]; ^ Class36.java:19: cannot find symbol symbol : variable i location: class Class36 aBooleanArray643 = new boolean[i + 1]; ^ Class36.java:19: incompatible types found : <nulltype> required: int aBooleanArray643 = new boolean[i + 1]; ^ Class36.java:20: cannot find symbol symbol : variable i location: class Class36 for(int j = 0; j < i + 1; j++) ^ Class36.java:20: operator < cannot be applied to int,<nulltype> for(int j = 0; j < i + 1; j++) ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 6 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
So what step did I mess up on, and what should I do to fix it? :S

item.title: Stupid Mistake
item.dc:creator: @Ardy3231 Ardy3231
item.description:
@Ardy3231 wrote:

Okay, so I was trying to do SWAT’s new emote system (http://www.rune-server.org/showthread.php?t=182332) and I was doing well until I hit this line:

And Add at the top of

public static void method257(int i, Class44 class44)
this

for(int j = 0; j < FrameStart.length; j++) FrameStart[j] = 0;

So I’ve been messing around (sorry, java newb here :’( ) and I’m trying to figure this out.

So I did two things:

public static void method257(int i, Class44 class44) { for(int j = 0; j < FrameStart.length; j++) FrameStart[j] = 0; Class30_Sub2_Sub2 class30_sub2_sub2 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub2(class44.method571("seq.dat", null), 891); anInt350 = class30_sub2_sub2.method410(); if(aClass20Array351 == null) aClass20Array351 = new Class20[anInt350]; for(int j = 0; j < anInt350; j++) { if(aClass20Array351[j] == null) aClass20Array351[j] = new Class20(); aClass20Array351[j].method259(true, class30_sub2_sub2);

And it gave me the following errors:

Class36.java:18: cannot find symbol symbol : variable i location: class Class36 aClass36Array635 = new Class36[i + 1]; ^ Class36.java:18: incompatible types found : <nulltype> required: int aClass36Array635 = new Class36[i + 1]; ^ Class36.java:19: cannot find symbol symbol : variable i location: class Class36 aBooleanArray643 = new boolean[i + 1]; ^ Class36.java:19: incompatible types found : <nulltype> required: int aBooleanArray643 = new boolean[i + 1]; ^ Class36.java:20: cannot find symbol symbol : variable i location: class Class36 for(int j = 0; j < i + 1; j++) ^ Class36.java:20: operator < cannot be applied to int,<nulltype> for(int j = 0; j < i + 1; j++) ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 6 errors Press any key to continue . . .

So what step did I mess up on, and what should I do to fix it? :S

Read full topic
